items.summary: Enhance the existing Quick Start flow (frontend/src/components/QuickStartDialog.tsx) to speed up repeated setup by offering: (1) a one-click random 'fireplace' session title suggestion, (2) a one-click 'Use previous title' option, and (3) auto-filling the Video Source URL with the previously used value when available.

Add explicit Google Drive share-link support messaging and validation in the Video Source URL inputs (Quick Start Step 2 in frontend/src/components/QuickStartDialog.tsx and the session Video Source panel in frontend/src/components/VideoSourcePanel.tsx): detect common Google Drive 'share' URL patterns and display required-permissions guidance to the user in English.

Add a 'Preset Import' slot to the Quick Start flow that lets a user paste structured entries (copied from a Google Docs file) containing video titles, RTMP ingest URL, stream key, and Google Drive video link; parse the pasted text using a strict format that is robust to other unrelated content in the document; allow selecting one parsed preset to auto-fill the Quick Start title, video source URL, and YouTube RTMP fields.

Add a 'Stream Health / Readiness' panel to the session details page (frontend/src/pages/SessionDetailPage.tsx) that provides (1) a network sufficiency warning based on browser-available network information and (2) a configuration readiness checklist that helps prevent common streaming failures (missing video source, missing output target, missing RTMP fields).

Provide a best-effort 'YouTube streaming verification' UX in the Stream Health / Readiness panel that helps the user confirm whether YouTube is actually receiving/playing the stream, without requiring Google/YouTube API keys: add an explicit manual verification workflow and allow the user to record a verification status per session locally.

Update the Quick Start UX copy and inline guidance to reflect Streamlabs/Prism-style failure avoidance: add concise, actionable tips at the point of input for common failure causes (permissions, incorrect RTMP URL vs stream key, missing video source, and starting before outputs are configured).
